page.title: 04FARMING 3
page.content: Parduvine is typical of the farms in the centre of our block. To the south the land rises and farming changes to stock rearing, beef cattle and sheep are kept. To the north of Parduvine farm where the land is lower, farmers concentrate on crop-farming. More recently farmers such as Thornton and Capielaw have been planting oilseed rape. This crop is not only pleasing to the eye but it is also very profitable to the farmer,with an average yield of about 30 cwt per acre. Arable farmers find that oilseed rape fits well into their rotation pattern. It can be planted immediately after the harvest of winter barley, and then it will be harvested the following July. "Oilseed rape takes most of the goodness out of the soil, so it cannot be planted in the same field the following year."Mr Logan.
